intro: Corbularia conspicua var. minor, commonly known as the small-flowered corbularia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for horticultural collections.
